Posted By: TheInfinitePet (8/22/2012 7:34:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A must have in any [Puresteel Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puresteel Paladin) Deck.  
  
The plan is simple, you move all your equipment on creatures that attack during your turn with the paladin and then you move everything back on her at the end of the turn. Next turn, you get fresh new 2/2 cat tokens and you simply repeat the process.  
  
I squashed and outnumbered a Township token deck with her and Puresteel Paladin!  
  
I have to admit she would make a great general as well.
posts.html:

Posted By: luxma (4/19/2011 1:41:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Yup, just another vote of "fantastic EDH general." One supercat picks up ALL the weapons and you're swinging with a 15/15 Flying Trample Lifelink Double Strike Deathtouch Vigilance Hexproof Wither Haste (and the longer it takes to say your creature's abilities, the more fun you're having). And with all the tokens you get every turn, the only creatures you need are equipment support. [Puresteel Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puresteel Paladin), [Brass Squire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brass Squire), [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic), [Auriok Windwalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auriok Windwalker), [Leonin Shikari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leonin Shikari), [Indomitable Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indomitable Archangel), [Taj-Nar Swordsmith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Taj-Nar Swordsmith), [Kor Outfitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Outfitter), then maybe an [Adaptive Automaton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adaptive Automaton) to get his Adaptive Autocat on, then you just fill the rest of the deck up with blades and bludgeons. Highly entertaining.
posts.html:
Yup, just another vote of "fantastic EDH general." One supercat picks up ALL the weapons and you're swinging with a 15/15 Flying Trample Lifelink Double Strike Deathtouch Vigilance Hexproof Wither Haste (and the longer it takes to say your creature's abilities, the more fun you're having). And with all the tokens you get every turn, the only creatures you need are equipment support. Puresteel Paladin, Brass Squire, Stoneforge Mystic, Auriok Windwalker, Leonin Shikari, Indomitable Archangel, Taj-Nar Swordsmith, Kor Outfitter, then maybe an Adaptive Automaton to get his Adaptive Autocat on, then you just fill the rest of the deck up with blades and bludgeons. Highly entertaining.

posts.post_content:
i logged in just to post the combo i made up it requires 4 key cards to make it work.  
#1 kemba,kha regent, of course shes your main reason for this combo  
#2 puresteel paladin, ya his effects kinda needed to my your life easier  
#3 mycosynth lattice, turns ALL permanents are artifacts and are colourless. ya this is a god send  
#4 bludgeon brawl, ya i know what your thinking, this means all none-creature permanents can be equipped for their converted mana cost which is jack all since puresteel has metal craft from every freaking thing.  
  
so that plays out to be this (keep in mind since puresteel is out your drawing for every equipment you play such as Accorder's Shield you draw a card)  
turn 1: play a plains tap throw out a sol ring (free mana and an artifact)  
turn 2: play a plains tap both through out puresteel play Everflowing Chalice with one kick  
turn 3: play a mountain tap for 3 play a bludgeon brawl play kemba.  
turn 4: play a land play mycosynth lattice equip kemba with everythi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
